posts.name: asaf meizner
posts.cooked:
in the last couple of days, we have noticed that we get a lot of communication errors and disconnections so we looked at the logs and noticed that every spark max motor gives the error ERROR 2 [CAN SPARK MAXI IDs: 13, 18, timed out while waiting for Periodic Status 2 or ERROR 2 [CAN SPARK MAXI Ds: 13, 18, 19, timed out while waiting for Periodic Status 4

we also get a ton of errors that look something like this

we also get

here are some log files logs.zip (87.2 KB)

we also have extreme CPU usage and really big packet loss

any idea whats causing these errors?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
First, check your CAN bus wiring and termination, as that seems like the most proximate potential cause given the messages.

One particular subsystem (ArmExtension) seems to be consuming most of the time (in periodic), so look at the code there to see if there’s anything that could be consuming a lot of time.

Sharing a link to your code would enable us to help you further.

posts.name: asaf meizner
posts.cooked:
the can bus has no problems with it (we checked using the rev hardware client, and the lights on the spark max don’t show any errors and the errors in the driver station are also when disabled)

in the arm extension periodic there is only adding one number to the shuffleboard and resetting an encoder once in a while

our code isn’t public yet but if there is something specific you need I can give it to you

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Is board a wrapper class, or something in WPILib?  If it’s something you wrote, what is the definition of addNum()? What is the definition of getExtension()?  What object types are hallEffect and encoder?

posts.name: asaf meizner
posts.cooked:
Asaf:

and disconnections so we looked at the logs and noticed that every spark max motor gives

board is a part of our library that talks to shuffleboards here is the part of the code in our library MAutils/src/main/java/com/ma5951/utils/MAShuffleboard.java at main · MA5951/MAutils · GitHub

ArmExtention is a subsystem and in the subsystem there is a function get extention that returns the encoder value

the encoder is a srx mag encoder

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
Ok.  It’s very puzzling to me why it would be showing a lot of time consumed there.

Switching back to CAN, the Spark Max’es identified in the CAN error messages (13, 18, 19), is a similar message occurring for all the Spark Max’es on the bus, or only those 3?  If it’s only those three, what are those three used for?  Where are they wired on the bus daisy chain?  Is your CAN bus wired as a standard daisy chain configuration or something different?

posts.name: asaf meizner
posts.cooked:
its only 18, 17, 13 and 19.

they are used for: 13 - intake (neo) 17 - gripper (neo 550) 18 - arm movement (neo) 19 - arm extension (neo)

all of the motors are in one can chain and its the normal configuration

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: At what location in the chain are those controllers?  E.g. what is the list of everything on the CAN chain in order, starting from the Rio?  Are these controllers grouped together, scattered, at the beginning or end?  What does your CAN bus utilization look like?

posts.name: asaf meizner
posts.cooked: 17,18,19 are the ones showing mostly and they are together in the chain but they are not the first in the chain and not the last one’s

posts.name: asaf meizner
posts.cooked: can you elaborate is what cantimeout is and why its happening

Can status frame 2 is the motor position and 4 is the alternate encoder velocity and position. Your CANBus utilization is probably high (I can’t see because I do not have a DS on my current computer) so I am assuming this. When you configure your spark max it has a timeout to send it synchronously. If you are setting it every 20ms then you are using ALOT of CAN bandwidth. Resulting in important periodic frames to be missed because they cannot be sent while the CAN bus is used. If you would like to reduce this in your code you should hold an offset of where 0 would be on your motor controller then use that as 0. That way the only CAN being used is the periodic frames.

posts.name: asaf meizner
posts.cooked: i might have understood you wrong but if the only CAN being used is the periodic frames wouldn’t you lose all the other data?
No, because it runs every 20ms and not for very long some other periodic frames will be able to send data as well

posts.name: asaf meizner
posts.cooked: il try it and will let you know if it works
